timeline.bodyText:
Seems we don't really need to pass ExtRequestPrebidEvents object.
Assume, we can use here eventsEnabled flag instead, based on ExtRequestPrebidEvents and account.getEventsEnabled().
So, as following BidResponseCreator can be refactored to rid off the account.getEventsEnabled() usage.
timeline.author: rpanchyk
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -107,7 +108,8 @@ public BidResponseCreator(CacheService cacheService, BidderCatalog bidderCatalog
      * including processing of winning bids with cache IDs.
      */
     Future<BidResponse> create(List<BidderResponse> bidderResponses, BidRequest bidRequest,
-                               ExtRequestTargeting targeting, BidRequestCacheInfo cacheInfo, Account account,
+                               ExtRequestPrebidEvents extRequestPrebidEvents, ExtRequestTargeting targeting,

timeline.bodyText:
We don't need any fields in this class.
It will be used just as marker.
timeline.author: rpanchyk
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,22 @@
+package org.prebid.server.proto.openrtb.ext.request;
+
+import lombok.AllArgsConstructor;
+import lombok.Value;
+
+/**
+ * Defines the contract for bidrequest.ext.prebid.events
+ */
+@AllArgsConstructor(staticName = "of")
+@Value
+public class ExtRequestPrebidEvents {
+
+    /**
+     * Defines the contract for bidrequest.ext.prebid.events.win
+     */
+    String win;

timeline.author: rpanchyk

timeline.bodyText:
Pls rename to shouldNotAddExtPrebidEventsIfExtRequestPrebidEventsIsNull.
Also, add the additional unit test when Account has eventsEnabled = false.
timeline.author: rpanchyk

timeline.message: Update caching due to new logic of events

timeline.bodyText: This check doesn't answer the question "Is events enabled?"
timeline.author: rpanchyk

timeline.bodyText: According to requirements eventsAllowedByRequest should not be applied to CacheService at all.
timeline.author: rpanchyk

timeline.bodyText:
According to requirements eventsAllowedByRequest should not be applied here.
i mean it should not affect the hb_winurl & hb_bidid targeting keywords.
timeline.author: rpanchyk
